pkgmetadata.longdescription: An Alternative to the Kruskal-Wallis Test Based on the Kendall Tau Ideas // The Concordance Test is a non-parametric method for testing whether two o more samples originate from the same distribution. It extends the Kendall Tau correlation coefficient when there are only two groups. For details, see Monge (2019) arXiv:1912.12880v1.
